stem: The nurse is at the scene of a multi-vehicle accident. Place the following clients in the priority order for transport/treatment according to the START (Simple Triage and Rapid Treatment) system.

options.text: GREEN: Client with multiple abrasions who is walking around the scene.
RED: Client with a sucking chest wound and respiratory rate of 34.
BLACK: Client with no spontaneous respirations even after airway repositioning.
YELLOW: Client with an open leg fracture and a palpable radial pulse; follows commands.

rationale.correct: Triage in mass casualty (MCI) focuses on 'the greatest good for the greatest number'. (1) RED tag (Immediate) - Life threat but rescuable. (2) YELLOW tag (Delayed) - Serious but stable. (3) GREEN tag (Minimal) - Walking wounded. (4) BLACK tag (Expectant) - Dead or unlikely to survive with available resources.
rationale.incorrect: Unlike hospital triage, in an MCI, the most 'unstable' (Black tag) is treated LAST, not first.
clinicalPearls: The first step in START triage is to ask all people who can walk to move to a designated area; these are automatically GREEN.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: In normal ER triage, an unresponsive person is Priority 1. In a MASS CASUALTY scenario, an unresponsive person who isn't breathing is Priority LAST (Black tag). Don't confuse the two systems.

reviewUnits.heading: Disaster Nursing and Triage
reviewUnits.body: Nurses must remain objective during disasters. Transport priority follows the color codes. Stress management and clear communication are vital.
